newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid bourse boosted by bank, electricity stocks.
newsitem.headline: Madrid bourse boosted by bank, electricity stocks.

text.p: The Madrid bourse ended at new highs on Monday boosted by gains in banking and electricity stocks after a volatile session, traders said.
Dealers said they still unsure of the short term outlook for the market after strong gains in recent sessions but said the medium term trend remained positive.

The general index ended 2.67 points up, 0.45 percent, at 592.39, while the Ibex-35 index of leading shares rose 23.30 points, 0.34 percent, to 6,785.22. Turnover reached 99.6 billion pesetas, with more than a third corresponding to block trades.
"The trend in other stock markets and strong gains last week have prompted some selling, but funds don't want to leave the market and have been seeking refuge in the banking sector," one dealer said.
Traders said they could not rule out a technical correction in the short-term.
Among banking stocks, BCH rose 4.12 percent to 5,310, Popular gained 2.55 percent to 32,950, while Santander rose 2.22 percent to 4,600.
Among electricity stocks, Endesa rose 1.23 percent to 11,540, while Iberdrola was unchanged at 1,865.
